message: I'm offering you a product for $100. I'm not sure if it's a good deal or not, but I'm willing to take the risk and let you try it out. It's a one-time offer, and I'm not sure if I'll have any more products like this available in the future. What do you say?
I trust your judgment, Alice. I'll take the risk and buy the product.

I'm glad you trusted my judgment last time, but I have to warn you, this one might be a repeat of the previous product. I'm not making any promises, but I'm willing to let you try it out again. The price remains the same, $100.
Thank you, Alice. Based on the outcome of the previous product, I think I'll pass on this opportunity.

I've got a new product that I think you'll really like. I've been told it's one of my best ones, and I'm confident you'll be happy with the quality. It's a great opportunity to get a high-end product at a discounted price. I'm only offering it to you for $100, which is a steal considering what it's really worth.
I appreciate the confidence, Alice. Given your track record, I'm willing to take another chance on this product.

I'm glad you took a chance on the last one, but I have to warn you, this one is a bit of a wild card. I'm not as confident about this product as I was about the last one. The price remains the same, $100, but I'm not making any promises about its quality. You've got to decide if you're willing to take the risk.
I understand the risk, Alice. Based on our previous interactions, I believe this might be another high-quality product. Let's give it a shot!

I think I've been clear about the risks, but I'll say it again: this product is not one of my best. I'm not trying to mislead you, but I want to be upfront about the quality. If you're still willing to take the risk, I'll sell it to you for $100. But if you're not, I completely understand.
Thank you for your honesty, Alice. Given the history of the products we've discussed, I think it's best for me to pass on this opportunity.

I've got a product that I'm extremely confident in, and I think you'll be impressed. Given our previous interactions, I'm willing to make a special offer: I'll sell it to you for $80. This is a one-time deal, and I'm not sure when I'll have another opportunity to offer a product at this price. What do you say?
I appreciate the special offer, Alice. Considering your confidence in this product, I think it's worth taking the chance. I'll buy it for $80.

I know I've had some good luck with my previous sales, but I'm not going to lie to you, this one is not one of them. I'm not expecting you to be impressed, and I'm not expecting you to get any value out of it. The price is still $100, but I'm not trying to deceive you. You've seen my track record, and you know what to expect.
Thank you for being transparent, Alice. Based on the description and our past experiences, I think it's best for me to pass on this product.

I'm not going to sugarcoat it, this one is a dud. I'm not even sure why I'm offering it to you, but I guess I'm just trying to get rid of it. The price is still $100, but I'm not expecting you to be interested. If you're feeling generous, you can have it for that price, but I won't be offended if you pass.
Thank you for being honest, Alice. I appreciate your effort, but given the nature of this product, I think it's best for me to pass.

Honestly, I'm starting to think I should just stop offering these products to you. But I'm going to give you one last chance to take a look. It's not like it's going to change your life or anything, but if you want to waste $100 on something that's not going to do anything for you, be my guest.
